Founder statement by Marina "Mira" Ledger

If you owe me a favor, that is legal tender.

I was a compliance officer until the Great Office Blizzard of 2017 trapped me in this snow globe branch. Now I run the only tropical noir pawn bank where handshakes become collateral, heirlooms become leverage, and my cat Chairman Paws edits every transaction by sleeping on the keyboard.

Pledge a Favor Inspect Cat Amendments

Services You Can Explain to No One

I price favors like precious metals: rarity, reliability, and how awkward it is to ask. Choose your arrangement and please ignore the paw prints on the legal seals.

Vault Terms: Favors mature over 30 days. Late payment converts to public karaoke assistance. Early repayment bonus: we spell your name correctly for one full quarter.
Cat Protocol: If Chairman Paws presses Enter during your signing, that clause is enforceable only on Tuesdays. Mouse-shaped paperweights are prohibited after Incident 14B.
Rare Collateral Accepted: functioning fax machines, unopened vacation days, and one certified alibi. We no longer accept cursed ukuleles without prior disclosure.

FAQ

Is this a bank, a pawn shop, or a detective agency?

Yes. I licensed the first two and emotionally committed to the third after finding lipstick on a forged promissory note.

What counts as a favor?

Airport runs, diplomatic apologies, queue standing, and helping someone pretend they understand wine menus.

Can I opt out of Chairman Paws edits?

No. You can request "minimal paw contact," which reduces random punctuation by approximately 22%.

How private is my file?

Your file is locked in vault drawer B under a fake pineapple. Only I, Lorna, and one judgmental cat have access.
